name: Disney's Saratoga Springs Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well what can i say about saratoga springs.... the hotel is amazing. the lobby is very posh and all the staff are very friendly. The location of the resort is ok, very close to downtown disney, that were the night life is, but ther is free bus transportation to take you to any theme park or hotel.
reviews.title: fantastic!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — the spa, the location, the staff and the cleanliness of resory

reviews.text: We stayed in the springs, that probably the closest block to the main pool. The main pool is a big and very clean area, but the pool water looks dirty!! its not its very clean bt it has a brown floor which makes it look a bit of a swamp like colour!!
reviews.title: Great resort, especially if you use the spa or golf course

likes.disliked: — Seemed like a typical resort. This may be nit-picking, but there was no shower cap or lotion!

reviews.text: the other pool which is located in congress park, very nice that pool, looks over a lake and downtown disney, this is the quiet pool. the only problem with sitting at this pool is that you cannot get unlimited drinks only at the main pool.
reviews.title: Nice but very spread out

likes.disliked: — Very spread out with hassled bus transportation

reviews.title: Saratoga Spring Break
reviews.text: unlimited drinks, will tell you about them now. On you r arrival buy a platic mug, about $10. you can get unlimited refills in this cup, well worth the money, as for a diet coke on disney is probably about $3!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the food in this hotel is average, nothing special. the ususal american food, chicken, burgers, waffles, sandwhices.... repetitive, but when we go we mainly eat out most nights.
reviews.title: truly magical

reviews.text: What a fabulous resort! Located on Disney property in the Downtown Disney area, it feels more like a home away from home than a hotel. Our 1 bedroom was equipped with a washer and dryer, (a box of Tide was provided each day) full kitchen including dishwasher, a jacuzzi tub and shower. Large enough for our family of four. The cleaning service came daily. We also opted for the meal plan, which was incredible! Our children ages 4 & 5 ate a meal with Disney characters at least once per day. We also ate at some nice restaurants at the other hotels nearby.
reviews.title: Great Familt Resort

reviews.text: We have stayed at other Disney properties before, but this is our new favorite!
reviews.title: Millions of Dreams, one nightmare

reviews.text: We stayed in a one bedroom villa in the Congress Park section that was walking distance to Downtown Disney. The accommodations were perfect for our family of three - a master bedroom (for Mom and Dad), full kitchen, full bath with separate whirlpool tub, and a pull out couch in the living room (for our 13 year old son). The room also had its own clothes washer and dryer.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, one of Disney's best!

likes.disliked: — No free internet - at these prices that is the least they could do!

reviews.text: We were having a magical day starting with our check in - our room was ready early, so we had some lunch, dropped off our carry on luggage in our room and ventured off to Epcot with our "ticket to the world," a photo id, and a small amount of cash. There was no need to bring along piles of cash or my credit card since I had charging privileges on my room key, right? Wrong! When we arrived at Epcot's Japan we combed the store and picked up a basket full of items. At the checkout, I presented my "ticket to the world" and it was rejected (despite the fact that I had provided my credit card on check -in and had charging privileges well above the amount of my purchase). The Japan staff was very gracious and called the Saratoga Springs front desk to figure out why my room key was not allowing a charge, despite the notation on the card that I did have charging privileges. The Saratoga desk staff told the clerk that I did not have charging privileges. When I took the phone and spoke to the Saratoga staff myself they told me that I did not give them a credit card (which I know I did because I signed a card saying that they had my credit card information and I was authorized to make room charges up to $1,500), and they also told me that I was not staying in the room where I had dropped off my carry on bags!! I asked the clerk where, then, was the bell staff delivering my checked baggage that was arriving via the magical express service? She did not know. To say the least, I was very, very troubled, so we returned to the hotel to try to get things straightened out.
reviews.title: Worth the price????????

likes.liked: — The proximity to Downtown Disney and the pool.
likes.disliked: — The hair on the bathroom floor

reviews.text: Back at the hotel, the manager said that there was no problem, who had I spoken to (of course I did not know), and they issued us new room keys saying that now we were "all set." There was no offer of compensation until I reminded the manager that I missed out on the rest of the evening in Epcot because I had to come back to take care of the apparent misinformation the clerk and I received from Saratoga Staff (was the computer lying too when it denied my attempt to charge)? The manager offered to have someone drive me back to Epcot. When we realized that the park was closing in 1 hour, he offered a fast pass for one ride the next day - a tiny bit of compensation for our trouble, but I figured that now that everything was worked out, my restful vacation could begin!
reviews.title: a bit disappointing for the price

likes.disliked: — uncomfortable pull-out couch, difficulty in getting the room we requested

reviews.text: My stay at Disney's Saratoga Springs Resort, last spring, was wonderful! A friend and I booked a week long stay at the resort, along with the disney express tickets, weeklong park hopper with add ons, and the disney dining plan. All of the above were well worth the money spent.
reviews.title: A Walk Disney World Vacation For Adults

likes.liked: — The proximity to Downtown Disney and relative lack of children.
likes.disliked: — The length of the bus ride to the parks.

reviews.text: Our room at S.S. overlooked a lake, as well as Downtown Disney. A small pool and hot tub were a moments walk from our door. I loved this, as it seems that most families with children went to the larger, themed pool, in the center of the property. You don't truly realize what lounging by the pool means, until you remove the hoards of screaming children. We also had the cutest little man tending to the pool. He would always greet us with a smiling hello, and ask us how we were doing. One day in particular, we had mixed some alcoholic drinks, poured them into the room glasses and brought them down to the pool. This is strictly against hotel policy by the way. Well along came our little pool cleaner, and I immediatly apologized for having broken the rules. He simply smiled, waved his hand at the sign, and said that "on vacation there are NO rules." Needless to say, we shared many a drink by the hot tub that week.
reviews.title: A very Disney Experience
Great accomodation, great food - little atmosphere
reviews.text: The room itself was nicely appointed. It contained a queen sized bed and bedroom, bathroom with shower and deep tub, a living room, dining area and kitchen. Another major plus was an in room washer and dryer. On the last night of the trip, which I usually spend packing and doing nothing, I was able to wash all of my laundry. The hotel even provided complimentary laundry detergent and dryer sheets. This saved me from having to do work when I got home.

My friend and I only ate at the hotel's Artist's Palette, which is a counter service restaurant located in the main hotel complex. The food was tasty, but I'd recommend venturing to some of the restaurants in Downtown Disney. This isn't hard to do either, considering Downtown Disney is only a short walk from the resort. This comes in handy too, as Downtown Disney is the only source of night life in the entire Walt Disney World Resort. If you pay for the park hopper ticket with add ons, you get free entrance to Paradise Island every night. This is a strip of about 8 night clubs to suit any taste. Our favorite was 8 tracks, the 70s and 80s themed club, as well as gay night at Mannequins (that's Thursday night for those who are interested). Drinks are a bit over priced, but then again isn't everything at Disney?
reviews.title: Great Stay
Lifeguard on duty - NOT REALLY!
reviews.text: One final note, I'd recommend paying for the Disney Dining plan. It is 40 dollars a day, per adult, but will save you hundreds of dollars for a week long trip. For a week long meal plan you get 7 daily snacks (water, bagel, apple, drink), 7 counter service meals (equivalent to eating at any of the parks' fast food eateries), and seven sit down meals (which you can double up to eat somewhere fancy). We decided to eat on our own buck one day, and doubled up a meal to eat at the Flying Fish Cafe, located in Disney's Boardwalk area. This was well worth the value, considering our two person dinner came to roughly 150 dollars. I hear they offer a premiere dining plan now, where you get two sit down meals a day, as well as two snacks, for a higher price. I'd still go for the basic meal plan, considering we found it difficult to finish our meals.

My seven children and I had a wonderful experience using this resort while visiting the Disney attractions. There are many amenities, the place is very well-kept down to the smallest detail, and the staff seem to go out of their way to look out for our needs. (E.g. I bought a lot of food at the shop, and the cashier called a bellhop to drive me to my building, not far away, in one of their carts.
reviews.title: Pristine environment+happy staff=completely satisfied family!

likes.disliked: — sometimes having to wait 20 min for the right bus

reviews.text: Like everything in the area, food is expensive. We saved money by using the dining plan, but we preferred to stay in for breakfast and spent about $5 for a box of raisin bran and $5 for two quarts of milk.
reviews.title: a great resort

likes.disliked: — the main bus stop across from the check in is way to crowded, not enough bus service

reviews.text: The two-bedroom suite had lovely appointments and a very practical layout in which the second bedroom had its own bathroom and large vanity area, away from the living areas. The master suite had a whirlpool tub and a very comfortable king-size bed. There were three televisions each with DVD players, and a full kitchen with coffeemaker, microwave, garbage disposal, range/oven, dishwasher, and full-size refrigerator. The bathrooms were beautifully tiled. The master bath was broken into three adjoining sections: the first had a sink and vanity with the whirlpool tub and a closet off to the side which included an ironing board and iron. Through the next door was a large glassed-in shower and pedestal sink. Off this room was another door to the toilet. This wasn't a tiny room either. Outside this area behind a louvered door was a stacking washer and dryer. Not full-size but perfect for doing a load each day.
reviews.title: Did not love the prings
Travels with a toddler & a baby...
reviews.text: Other than a light bulb that didn't work, all was in order in our suite. I enjoyed sitting out on the patio in the mornings with my coffee and a view of the landscaping which had been given much attention to detail.

reviews.title: Sometimes beautiful does not matter!
reviews.text: The grounds of the resort are beautiful and we had free bus access to the parks and the Disney Express brought us from the airport and back. We didn't have to handle our luggage once the bell hop picked it up until we got it at our home airport. We even received our boarding passes before leaving the resort.

description: Disney's Saratoga Springs Resort & Spa is an equestrian-themed, Victorian-style Disney Deluxe Villa Resort on the shores of Village Lake. Inspired by historic Saratoga Springs, a late-1800s New York retreat famous for its spas and horse racing, the buildings and grounds of this 65-acre Resort are truly inviting.
